Okay, let's break this down. My current ante is at 7/8, with a chip goal of 70,000. Right now, I have 61,350 chips, so I need 8,650 more. I only have two hands left and no discards. My hand is: Queen of Spades (Wild), 10 of Spades, 10 of Hearts, 9 of Hearts, 4 of Hearts, Queen of Clubs (Gold), 9 of Clubs, 9 of Diamonds, and 8 of Diamonds.

I have a bunch of jokers: Juggler (+1 hand size), Wily Joker (+100 chips on 3OAK), Shoot the Moon (+10 Holo mult, +13 mult per Q in hand), Half Joker (+20 mult if hand is <= 3 cards), Card Sharp (X3 mult if hand type already played this round - and 3OAK has been played twice), and Chicot (X1.5 mult, disables boss effect). I also have "The Lovers" consumable, which enhances a card to Wild, but I don't need it right now.

My strategy needs to hit that 8,650 chip target. My best bet is to play a Three of a Kind (3OAK), specifically targeting the Nines. This will trigger Wily Joker for 100 bonus chips, Card Sharp for a 3x multiplier, and Half Joker for 20 extra mult.

I've checked the 3OAKs: I have the Nines (9H, 9C, 9D) in positions 4, 7, and 8. The Tens with the Wild Queen look tempting, but I don't want to discard my queens for the Shoot the Moon bonus.

The base chips for a level 3 3OAK are 70. Adding the card values gives 27, and Wily adds 100, totaling 197. My base multiplier for a level 3 3OAK is 7. I'll get +10 mult from Shoot the Moon (Holo) and an additional 26 mult from having two Queens (QS and QC) in my hand, and another +20 from Half Joker because the hand will have exactly three cards. This gives me 63 total mult. Then, the Card Sharp gives a x3 mult, and Chicot (Polychrome) gives a x1.5 mult.

So, the total multiplier is 63 * 3 * 1.5, which is 283.5. Multiplying this by the chip total of 197 is 55,849.5 chips! I've double-checked my work, and the calculation looks accurate. This is more than enough to crush the target of 8,650, so I'm set! The Lovers consumable is unnecessary, so I won't use it.

The joker arrangement doesn't matter, as long as the base mults are applied first, and the multiplicative mults are at the end.

The final action: play cards in positions 4, 7, and 8 which are the three Nines.

My final chip total will be 61350 + 55849 = 117199, a resounding victory.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

**Strategic Shop Selection: Ante 8 Optimization**

Okay, so it's the final ante, Ante 8, and the goal is to hit that 100k+ score against the boss. Right now, I've got $12 to spend in the shop. My focus is still on maximizing the Three of a Kind strategy, which is already at Level 3. I have some strong Jokers in play: Juggler (+1 hand size), Wily Joker (+100 Chips on 3OAK), Shoot the Moon (Holo +10 Mult, +13 Mult per Queen), Half Joker (+20 Mult if hand size <= 3), Card Sharp (X3 Mult if hand type repeated), and Chicot (X1.5 Mult, Disables Boss Blind). I'm also holding The Lovers consumable. I also have some useful vouchers: Telescope, Paint Brush, Director's Cut, Tarot Merchant, Blank, Antimatter.

My immediate analysis screams for a Mega Celestial Pack. Why? Because the Telescope voucher guarantees that a Celestial pack will contain the Planet card, and since I've played Three of a Kind 23 times, it's a lock for Earth. The Mega pack lets me pick two cards, and getting Earth for my primary strategy is essential. That's an $8 purchase, leaving me with $4.

Now, should I consider any other items? The Arcana Pack ($4) could be helpful for deck manipulation. The Blue Joker (+110 Chips) is slightly better than Wily Joker, but I'd have to sell Juggler to fit it in, which I'm hesitant to do. The Justice card (Glass card, $3) is tempting for the x2 Mult bonus, but it's a consumable and breaks, and right now I can't think of how to strategically use it. Reroll Surplus is out of the question at $10.

Given the options, buying the Mega Celestial Pack is the clear priority. Upgrading the Three of a Kind level is the best way to scale. I need to get as high a multiplier as possible to get over the target.

I'm sticking with the Mega Celestial Pack.
I'll go with `{"action": "buy_booster", "positions": [1]}`.
That takes the highest priority. I'll re-evaluate the Arcana pack after.
